Class Arc<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>,E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Arc<T,E>

  • public class Arc<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>,E>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents the edge object in a graph
    Author:
    Kevin Barroga

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Arc()
      No-argument constructor
      Arc(java.lang.Boolean directed, java.lang.Integer weight)
      Two-argument constructor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEnds(Vertex<T,E> brother, Vertex<T,E> sister)
      Adds vertices to the edge with the assumption that none had previously existed
      void deleteEnds()
      Deletes the end vertices of this edge and updates each vertices corresponding adjacency lists
      E getAnnotation(T key)
      Returns the object that corresponds to the key specified in the annotations hashmap
      Vertex<T,E> getDestination()
      Returns a pointer to a vertex that is the destination vertex of the directed edge, throws InvalidEdgeException if undirected
      java.util.ArrayList<Vertex<T,E>> getEnds()
      Returns an array list of the end vertices of the edge
      T getKey()
      Returns the key of the edge
      Vertex<T,E> getOrigin()
      Returns a pointer to a vertex that is the origin vertex of the directed edge, throws InvalidEdgeException if undirected
      java.lang.Integer getWeight()
      Returns the weight of the edge
      boolean isDirected()
      Returns true if the edge is directed and false if it is not
      void makeDirected(Vertex<T,E> brother, Vertex<T,E> sister)
      Makes the edge directed and updates corresponding directed adjacency lists on the end vertices
      void makeUndirected()
      If the edge is directed, makes it undirected and updates all corresponding directed edge adjacency lists, does nothing if the edge is already undirected
      void reverseDirection()
      Reverses the direction of the edge if it is directed, otherwise throws InvalidEdgeException
      void setDirection(Vertex<T,E> brother, Vertex<T,E> sister)
      Sets the direction for the edge and make it directed
      void setDirectionFrom(Vertex<T,E> newOrigin)
      Sets the direction of the edge from the argument vertex as long as it is already an end vertex, throws InvalidEdgeException otherwise
      void setDirectionTo(Vertex<T,E> newDestination)
      Sets the direction of the edge to the argument vertex as long as it is already an end vertex, throws InvalidEdgeException otherwise
      void setKey(T brother, T sister)
      Sets the new key for the edge

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • setKey

        public void setKey(T brother,
          T sister)
        Sets the new key for the edge
        Parameters:

        sister, - the second part of the new key

      • addEnds

        public void addEnds(Vertex<T,E> brother,
           Vertex<T,E> sister)
        Adds vertices to the edge with the assumption that none had previously existed
        Parameters:
        brother, - the first end vertex
        sister, - the second end vertex

      • deleteEnds

        public void deleteEnds()
        Deletes the end vertices of this edge and updates each vertices corresponding adjacency lists

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(Vertex<T,E> brother,
                Vertex<T,E> sister)
        Sets the direction for the edge and make it directed
        Parameters:
        brother, - pointer to the new origin vertex
        sister, - pointer to the new destination vertex

      • setDirectionTo

        public void setDirectionTo(Vertex<T,E> newDestination)
                    throws InvalidEdgeException
        Sets the direction of the edge to the argument vertex as long as it is already an end vertex, throws InvalidEdgeException otherwise
        Parameters:
        newDestination, - pointer to the new destination vertex for the edge
        Throws:
        InvalidEdgeException

      • setDirectionFrom

        public void setDirectionFrom(Vertex<T,E> newOrigin)
                      throws InvalidEdgeException
        Sets the direction of the edge from the argument vertex as long as it is already an end vertex, throws InvalidEdgeException otherwise
        Parameters:
        newOrigin, - pointer to the new origin vertex
        Throws:
        InvalidEdgeException

      • makeDirected

        public void makeDirected(Vertex<T,E> brother,
                Vertex<T,E> sister)
        Makes the edge directed and updates corresponding directed adjacency lists on the end vertices
        Parameters:
        brother, - pointer to the origin of the edge
        sister, - pointer to the destination of the edge

      • makeUndirected

        public void makeUndirected()
        If the edge is directed, makes it undirected and updates all corresponding directed edge adjacency lists, does nothing if the edge is already undirected

      • reverseDirection

        public void reverseDirection()
                      throws InvalidEdgeException
        Reverses the direction of the edge if it is directed, otherwise throws InvalidEdgeException
        Throws:
        InvalidEdgeException
